'''''The Poetry of J.R.R. Tolkien''''' is booklet by George Burke Johnston, containing an essay about [[J.R.R. Tolkien]]'s poetry. The essay features a reprint of Tolkien's poem "[[The Root of the Boot]]" (pages 10â€“11) which was first published in ''[[Songs for the Philologists]]''. Burke Johnston's essay is a slightly revised version of that published in ''[[The Tolkien Papers]]''.

The booklet was not intended for sale, and was privately circulated by Burke Johnston. A "specially printed, specially bound copy of the booklet" was sent to Tolkien, who [[Letter to George Burke Johnston|responded on 24 May 1968]].<ref>{{webcite|author=|articleurl=http://www.tolkienbooks.net/php/details.php?reference=13820|articlename=Poetry of J.R.R. Tolkien. 1967|dated=|website=TB|accessed=7 January 2017}}</ref>

The booklet was also printed in a 1968 edition, with red lettering on the cover instead of black.<ref>{{webcite|author=|articleurl=http://www.tolkienbooks.net/php/details.php?reference=13830|articlename=Poetry of J.R.R. Tolkien. 1968|dated=|website=TB|accessed=7 January 2017}}</ref>
